ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà zẅéte pʉ̀a á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie à náa né pi. Pi leen ńké ńzyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mɔ́b, ńjÿó shúm sɔ́b; ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mendá mɔ́b, ńtsẅé wó.
en: “When the Lord your God annihilates the nations whose land he is giving you,   so that you drive them out and live in their cities and houses,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gʉa na metÿǒsoŋ mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à nǎ né pi tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, páʼ pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú, é tsɔ́ʼ metÿǒsoŋ méntá.
en: you are to set apart three cities for yourselves within the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo engwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à nǎ né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́, e gwɔ́ mepàga láʼ méntá, pi piŋ ńnyɛte melǎŋ mie é gee né tsɛ̀ɛ mɛ̌ metÿǒsoŋ, légwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ kÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen wó.
en: You are to determine the distances   and divide the land the Lord your God is granting you as an inheritance into three regions, so that anyone who commits manslaughter can flee to these cities.  # 19:3 Lit flee there

ngiemboon: Ammó gie ngwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo ńcʉ́ʼʉ fÿɛ́, tá ńkÿo, ńgʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ na mɔɔn metÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ tá ńtsẅɛ́ á yɔɔn: ngwɔ́ á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ fʉa pwó ńzẅé fɛ̌ we, mbà à zɔ̌ɔn laa yé pʉa.
en: “Here is the law concerning a case of someone who kills a person and flees there to save his life, having killed his neighbor accidentally without previously hating him:

ngiemboon: Mé gɔɔn páʼ ngwɔ́ nyìŋ pɔ́ fɛ̌ we gʉa mbàʼ, lékɔ́ʼ metÿǒ, ńtóo ńkaʼ nzɔɔn, é fó na fʉ́, ésoŋo, ńkɔ́ʼɔ fɛ̌ we tà á kwé. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ púʼu, angàŋ kÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tàʼ na metÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ tá ńtsẅɛ́.
en: If, for example, he goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut timber, and his hand swings the ax to chop down a tree, but the blade flies off the handle and strikes his neighbor so that he dies, that person may flee to one of these cities and live.

ngiemboon: Ńdyeen púʼu, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ ngwɔ́ afɛ̌ mpfó gẅie à gẅiin létsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅě yé, á lɔgɔ gyáŋalóŋ, ńnɔ́ɔn yé, ńzẅé. Ńtí nue à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mánzsè sag tɛʼ, á kúu ńcúɔ yé, á kwé, tá mbà á kɔʼɔ́ te nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ mé cúɔ yé ńzẅé wɔ́. Ńtí nue à ka zɔɔn te ne ḿbʉa fɛ̌ we wɔ́.
en: Otherwise, the avenger of blood in the heat of his anger   might pursue the one who committed manslaughter, overtake him because the distance is great, and strike him dead. Yet he did not deserve to die,  # 19:6 Lit did not have a judgment of death since he did not previously hate his neighbor.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, n tsẅii mbwó gù ngie ɔ̀ tsɔ́ʼ metÿǒsoŋ méntá.
en: This is why I am commanding you to set apart three cities for yourselves.

ngiemboon: Páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à lɔɔn ńkẅiʼi tsetsáʼa gí, páʼ à la kʉa mbwó metá pí púʼu. Ḿbiŋ ńná ngwòŋ ntsèm gẅie à la kaʼa lénáa mbwó metá pí.
en: If the Lord your God enlarges your territory as he swore to your ancestors, and gives you all the land he promised to give them #— #

ngiemboon: Mbà nò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pi tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na membʉ̌ mie n tÿɔ̌g né pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te. Ńkwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ńne ńgiŋe na memánzsè mé. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ púʼu, pi gíŋe ńkẅiʼi metÿǒsoŋ méntá, á na mɛ̌ méntá.
en: provided you keep every one of these commands I am giving you today and follow them, loving the Lord your God and walking in his ways at all times #— #you are to add three more cities to these three.

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, mé le gíŋe ḿpfɛte metse tefʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ka nǎ né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́ wɔ́. Metse mé piŋ ńké le twó pi sẅɛ́ʼ.
en: In this way, innocent blood will not be shed, and you will not become guilty of bloodshed in the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, nyìŋ mesoŋ lɔɔn ḿbʉa fɛ̌ we, ńnuŋe nzòŋ, ńgwe na yé, ńcúɔ yé, tà á kwé, ńkÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na metÿǒsoŋ mɔɔn,
en: But if someone hates his neighbor, lies in ambush for him, attacks him, and strikes him fatally, and flees to one of these cities,

ngiemboon: mbà melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ge gÿo mé gwoon yé, ńnáa yé mbwó fɛ̌ mpfó gẅie à gẅiin létsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅě yé, à zẅé yé.
en: the elders of his city are to send for him, take him from there, and hand him over to the avenger of blood and he will die.

ngiemboon: Tà pi líe yé, ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé; pi lɔɔn ḿbyág papfɛte metse patefʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ púʼu, mbà pi ge júʼ mboŋó.
en: Do not look on him with pity but purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, and you will prosper.

ngiemboon: Pi te gẅiin lésẅɛʼte lepàa nkáʼ fɛ̌ gẅi sie melÿò la tÿɔ́gɔ na tÿɔgɔ́ gie pi ge gẅiin, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, náa né pi, páʼ pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú wɔ́.
en: “Do not move your neighbor’s boundary marker,   established at the start in the inheritance you will receive in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tàʼ jÿòngyá gíle yé, le gɔɔn nò ńtí nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌ʼ nò, kà fʉa pɔ́ nò wɔ́ɔ, kà ńgÿo pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ wɔ́ɔ, mé fó mǒ ńzáʼ ntsaŋ wɔ́. Mé ge gwaa ŋaga tàʼ ntsaŋ tà záʼ, pajÿòngyá, mépʉ́a kà métá wɔ́ɔ, e gɔɔn nò.
en: “One witness cannot establish any iniquity or sin against a person, whatever that person has done.   A fact must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.  # 19:15 Mt 18:16; Jn 8:17; 2Co 13:1

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ jÿòngyá we cÿɔ̌nò lɔɔn ńtÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ,
en: “If a malicious witness   testifies against someone accusing him of a crime,

ngiemboon: mbà pɛ̌ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a pie ntsaŋ líe wɔ́b ge tyé jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á mvfò panuŋepwɔʼ lâ paŋagntsaŋ pie é ne faʼa na yɛ̌ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́.
en: the two people in the dispute are to stand in the presence of the Lord before the priests and judges in authority at that time.

ngiemboon: Á gie paŋagntsaŋ lɔɔn éshÿéenshÿéen ńtúŋte nò mǒ, ńgyá mbà jÿòngyá, à cÿɔ̌nò, ńtÿɔ́g sóon twó fɛ̌ we;
en: The judges are to make a careful investigation, and if the witness turns out to be a liar who has falsely accused his brother,

ngiemboon: mbà pi ge gÿo mmó gie à ka kwaŋa légÿo na fɛ̌ we, á na yé. É gÿo púʼu, é lɔg pyága nò tepòŋ á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: you must do to him as he intended to do to his brother. You must purge the evil from you.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo ńjúʼ, ńcÿɔʼ; mé le gíŋ ńdáʼ ńtɔ́ɔn tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ páʼ yɛ̌ á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́.
en: Then everyone else will hear and be afraid, and they will never again do anything evil like this among you.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn légÿo ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe nyìŋ gẅie à tɔ̌ɔn nò tepòŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅé nyìŋ, mé zẅé yé yé, ḿbyág lejÿɔ́g nyìŋ, mé pyág sé yé, ńtsɔ́ʼ lesoŋ nyìŋ, mé tsɔ́ʼ sé yé, ńnéŋ fʉ̌ŋ pwó nyìŋ kà kwò yé wɔ́ɔ, mé néŋ ye yé, á kwàʼ na jʉʼ gie à něŋ ye wɛ̌ nyìŋ wó.
en: Do not show pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, and foot for foot.
